intro: Dianthera acuminatissima, commonly known as the sharp-pointed dianthera, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in moist, tropical environments. Dianthera acuminatissima is often found in shaded, humid areas within rainforests.
